definition: to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The gunshot started three birds at one time.
sentences.chinese: 枪声一下子把三只鸟给惊飞了。

sentences.english: The explosion scattered a flock of birds roosting in the trees.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸声把树上的鸟惊飞了。

sentences.english: Oh, the railings beat fierce poetry, places crane flush dew gowns.
sentences.chinese: 哦诗猛把阑干拍，宿鹤惊飞露湿袍。

sentences.english: The white bird flew to the top of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿一惊飞到了树顶上。

sentences.english: A woodcock flushed from its cover.
sentences.chinese: 一只兰鹬从藏身处惊飞而起。

sentences.english: With a shot of gun, the birds were flushed from the nest.
sentences.chinese: 一声枪响，鸟儿从巢中惊飞而起。

sentences.english: The hunter's dog flushed a flock of birds.
sentences.chinese: 猎人的狗惊飞了一群鸟。

definition: to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
to scare a bird into flight
(bird species of China) Eurasian jackdaw (Coloeus monedula)
to fly as a flock/to flock together
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
cry of a crane or wild goose
